title: Vase, 1902–07
markings:
Impressed on the bottom, underglaze, partially indistinct: WELLER
Incised on the bottom, underglaze: 53.
provenance:
Todd M. Volpe 
Marcia and William Goodman
dimensions: H x Diam: 14 x 11.1 cm (5 3/8 x  4 3/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description: Buff-gray clay body, cast. Slightly bulbous body, tapering to neck with crimped molded leaf rim; two small curved handles at shoulder to rim; no foot. Design on front and back of honeysuckle blossoms and vines against a random dot pattern painted in gold. Iridescent background shades from a blue-green to a lavender-purple towards the shoulder. Interior covered with lustrous copper-red glaze. Bottom glazed a greenish-yellow high glaze; unglazed foot rim. Cracklature. Two-handled

exhibitions.title: New Vistas:  American Art Pottery from The Cooper-Hewitt Museum
